snippet: Mexico City might be one of the world’s classic megacities, but it is also an archaeological wonder, with surprises still being uncovered in the city’s superimposed layers.
abstract: Mexico City Journal; Mexico City is one of the world's archaeological wonders, with many surprises still to be uncovered in the vast metropolis, often found accidentally as a result of the city's progress and constant rebuilding; latest finds include an unusual Aztec burial site in the city's main central square.

byline.original: By ELISABETH MALKIN and SOFIA CASTELLO Y TICKELL

lead_paragraph: Mexico City might be one of the world’s classic megacities, but it is also an archaeological wonder, with surprises still being uncovered in the city’s superimposed layers.

headline.seo: Mexico City’s Aztec Past Keeps Emerging in the Present
headline.main: Mexico City’s Aztec Past Reaches Out to Present
headline.print_headline: City’s Aztec Past Reaches Out to Present
